Articles.Content:
Behold:

My twitch highlight

wip

If you know of the comic Tintin or just want a simple, classical rocket, download it here.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Note that this ship doesn't have enough fuel to make it to the mun (barely to orbit) so I removed all fuel. Use debug fuel (THE HORROR). Yeah I know but this ship did land on the moon in "Destination Moon" and return via powered descent so I see no reason it shouldn't in KSP!

Also note that I removed the Nuclear engines as there really isn't a need in them.

Enjoy!

Edited July 3, 2014 by Avera9eJoe

They made artificial gravity by having the engines on, all the time.

I loved that comic.

I never did finish reading this one. DUnno why. (Tintin was in one of the books my sister had a subscription to. I don't think I read anything else out of that book so I don't even remember what it was)

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/b/bb/The_Adventures_of_Tintin_-_16_-_Destination_Moon.jpg

They made artificial gravity by having the engines on, all the time.

I loved that comic.

Oh well with infinite fuel you CAN run with constant gravity! xD

And two of you! It's good to know there are others who have read at all

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/b/bb/The_Adventures_of_Tintin_-_16_-_Destination_Moon.jpg

They made artificial gravity by having the engines on, all the time.

I loved that comic.

It was clearly a Heinlenian torchship with nuclear drive! After all, it was built by professor Calculus, so advanced tech is a given (I had to look that up, for me he will always be "profesor Tornasol").

Rune. Really good looking replica!

I never read the books, but I do still love the animated series to this day. I haven't ever seen the one where they go to the moon yet but I'm sure it's out there somewhere on the internet.

Great looking replica, as has already been said. Takes me back to my childhood days when I used to watch Tintin, but was too young to understand it because of all the complexities... Now that I'm older I can appreciate it more.

Good job!!
Hah, Awsome. That was the first book in the series I ever read, and a good replica. Can I reccomend the kerb paint mod? With that you could (to some extent) get it the same colour as well.

Hah, Awsome. That was the first book in the series I ever read, and a good replica. Can I reccomend the kerb paint mod? With that you could (to some extent) get it the same colour as well.

I have the kerb paint mod bookmarked, but not in use. If you want I could repaint and post a picture . And thanks all!
